hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director of Innovation, Boston Children’s Hospital
Vice President of Innovation, Partners HealthCare

hackathon-eligibility: : Individuals (18 years of age and older)
hackathon-rules: athenahealth and the More Disruption Please program are committed to creating events for the whole community that encourage growth and learning in the healthcare industry. With this in mind, we’ve created a Code of Conduct to ensure a safe and fun environment for all participants. We expect our participants to treat everyone with respect, be open minded, have a positive attitude, and encourage everyone to participate. Everyone comes from different industries and has different levels of skill, but it’s this diversity of thinking that could bring us the next big breakthrough in health care. Most importantly, harassment of any kind will not be tolerated. athenahealth reserves the right to take action at its sole discretion, including removing Contestants or Participants from the Innovation Challenge hackathon.
hackathon-requirements:
Create a viable software solution, prototype and/or business plan that addresses a pressing pain point for hospitals and/or health systems (i.e., inpatient facilities).
: include, but are not limited to, core hospital modalities, virtualization of ancillary services, discharge planning, care handoffs, and medication tracking. Participants are encouraged, but not required, to tackle one of the problems highlighted in athenahealth CEO Jonathan Bush’s recent
: a working software application, prototype and/or business plan, demonstration video (if applicable), and a PDF presentation (10 slides or less).
any software platform will be accepted. However, participants should note that a preference will be made for those solutions that are cloud-based.
hackathon-description-header: Help Us Build a Hospital in the Cloud

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What is the potential impact of the solution, in terms of both scope and size, on the hospital market?
How creative, original, and innovative is the solution? How effective is it in utilizing technology to solve the proposed problem?
Is the business model well thought-out, realistic, and scalable?
How usable, human-centered, and satisfying is the user experience?
What makes this team the right team to solve this problem and bring the technology to market?
How clear and persuasive is the presentation, video, and/or prototype?
